quote: Computer, set heading one-four-zero    mark three-two...
Course laid in.
Maximum warp.  Engage.
Time to the Parada system.
One hour, fourteen minutes.

Create a new file, Computer.  O'Brien    personal log.  Stardate 47581.2.       I've gotta try to set the record    straight about the last fifty-two    hours.  I don't know who's gonna    hear this.  I don't even know if    I'll be alive by the time this log    is recovered.  I figure they'll be    coming after me.
If I'm right about all this... they    won't want me to warn the Paradas.       Coffee.  Jamaican blend.  Double    strong.  Double sweet.

I wish I could tell you who they    are.  That's part of the puzzle I    haven't figured out.  Part of the    puzzle, hell.  None of this whole    damn thing makes any sense.       I'm trying to remember the first    time I noticed that things were...    wrong.  It seems to me... yeah...
... it had to be the first morning    after I got back to the station...
What are you two doing up so early... ?
Oh, I just have a lot to catch up on    at school.  Thought I'd get an early    start...
At five-thirty in the morning?       Coffee... Jamaican blend... double    strong, double sweet...
I have a dozen essays to read.
Didja have sweet dreams, darlin'... ?
Go away.
Hey, don't I get my morning kiss?
No.
What'd I do to deserve that?
It's just a phase, Miles.  She doesn't    mean it.
Huh.
Don't let it bother you.
What time'd you get to bed last night?
I don't know.  Late.  I didn't want    to wake you.
I was tired.  I guess the trip really    took a lot out of me.
What did they have you doing?

The Paradas?  Oh, they put me through    basic training on all the security    measures they want in place for the    peace talks... Odo would have had a    field day... I wish he could have    been there...
I'll drop Molly off at day care on    my way to Ops...
No, that's okay.  I'm taking her    with me.       Molly...
To school... while you try to read?     That doesn't make a lot of sense...
There's something I wanted to show    her... a Vulcan program that teaches    basic problem solving skills...
At five-thirty-five in the morning...    what's gotten into you?
I want to do it while her mind is    fresh.
If you say so.
We'll see you later.
What's this?
Just getting a head start, Chief...
Head start.  Everybody seems to be    getting a "head start" on me today...
Sir?

DeCurtis, I appreciate your bushy-   tailed enthusiasm... but I wanted to    wait until Odo came back from Bajor    to do this.  We have to realign the    entire security net for the peace    talks.  The Constable might have a    few things to say about it all...
Commander Sisko didn't feel we should    wait for Odo...
Sisko gave you permission to start    this... without checking with me    first?  I don't think so...
You... might want to check with him,    Chief.  I'm only following orders.
Oh, I'll check with him all right.
Mister O'Brien... ?
Carry on.
Computer, how much longer to the    Parada system... ?
Fifty-three minutes...
Direct sensors back toward the    wormhole.  Scan for other warp    signatures on this heading...
One warp signature found.
Display on monitor.
Can you identify...
Identification confirmed.  Starfleet    runabout Mekong.
I figured as much.  They'll wait    until I drop out of warp and then...       Well, we'll have to cross that bridge    when we come to it, won't we?
Please restate question.
Disregard, computer.  Continue    personal log.
Okay, so it was all a little    curious... but who could've guessed    at that point...

I mean, the way they were acting,    they might've been trying to pull    off one of those surprise parties    that I can't stand... only my    birthday's not until September...    and believe me, as it turned out, I    had nothing else to celebrate.
There he is now... I've been waiting    for you, Chief...
What is it, Julian.
No excuses this time.
Excuses...
I want you in my office in one hour...
For what?
Your physical.  You can't put it off    any longer...
This isn't a good day...
It's a perfect day.  Commander Sisko    has arranged to have you covered    and...
What are you doing going to the    Commander about my check-up?
I just know how you are about...
Well, forget it... I've got things    to do...
I'm afraid I'll have to insist.  If    I have to order you as your superior    officer, I will.
Is there a problem?
Mister O'Brien says he's unavailable    for a physical.
Make yourself available, Chief.
Commander...
Doctor Bashir's annual report on the    senior staff is due next week at    Starfleet.  We've all had to go    through this.
Fine.  Fine, I'll be there in an    hour.
Can I talk to you for a minute, Sir?
Ensign DeCurtis mentioned to me you    were a little upset...
Not upset, exactly...
No, no, you had every right to be...    I'm sorry I assigned him without    advising you... I dropped the ball    on that one...
I guess I just felt... a little out    of the loop, you know...
Understood.       I've looked through your report on    the Paradas... they seem unusually    preoccupied with security...
They may be a little paranoid.  But    I suppose we would be too if we'd    been in a civil war for twelve    years...
Anything else I should know about    them... any unusual protocols they    might observe when they get here...
Nothing too out of the ordinary.     It's all pretty much in my report.
Tell me something that isn't in the    report.
Sir?
You know, the kind of things we don't    include in reports... but might help    me in these talks...

I'll have to give it some thought.     There was one thing I noticed -- I    don't know if it means anything or    not -- but the Paradas have an odor,    from some kind of skin excretions,    I'd guess... and it changes with    their mood... when they're upset, it    can get pretty strong actually.
I'll try not to get them upset.
Good idea.
Their leaders have been in regular    contact with us.  I've assured them    that we'll be following all of their    security recommendations to the    letter.
I'll see to that...
Well, I certainly want you to check    everything before they get here...    but the upfront work can be done by    the Engineering crews... I have bigger    problems for you...
Bigger?
All three upper pylons are down again.
That's impossible... I went over the    repair work yesterday... the pressure    locks seemed to be at maximum    efficiency...
You'd better check again... we had    to tow a Bolian freighter to a lower    dock this morning...
It can't be anything that serious...    I rebuilt that entire subsystem    myself... I'll get on it right away...
After your physical.
Yessir.    (beat, pauses by the     door)   By the way -- I noticed you and    Keiko... out in front of the school...    talking this morning.  Anything wrong?
Oh... Jake's having some problems    with his grades.
Sorry to hear that.  Keiko's very    fond of the boy.  I'm sure she'll    work that much harder to help him,    sir.
Yes, I'm sure she will.
Are we nearly finished?  I believe    you've poked into every orifice of    my body... and created a few new    ones.
Any dizziness... oversleeping...    lack of energy... euphoria?
Yes.  All of them.  Especially    euphoria.  Lots of euphoria.
Seriously.
If you're determined to keep me here    until you find something wrong with    me, I'll see if I can't grow a    hangnail.
Eye problems?  Hearing?  Headaches?
Headache.  There you go.  As a matter    of fact, I'm getting one right now...
(making notes on a     PADD)   Short temper... flies off the handle    under slight provocation...    (smiles, an aid for     O'Brien's benefit)   Perfectly normal behavior.
I'm glad you're enjoying this.
Sorry.  I know how you feel about    doctors.
It's not doctors I have problems
... it's you, Julian.
Well, your sense of humor seems normal    enough...
I don't have a sense of humor.
Cough.       And how's your sex life?
I don't have a sense of humor.
Cough.       Everything okay in that department?
That department is none of Starfleet's    business.  Or yours.
Mother and father in good health?
Come on, Julian, you knew my mother    died two years ago.
Did I?
You don't remember me telling you    when my Dad remarried last spring...    me blathering on about this woman    I've never met... ?
Of course.  Now, I remember.
Are you finished?
Not quite, I do want to run a few    more tests on...
This is insane.  I haven't had a    physical take this long since I was    born.
Now unless I'm dying or something,    I think it's about time I --
That isn't it, is it?  I mean --    is there something wrong with me?     Is that why everyone seems so...
Relax, Chief.  I'm giving you a clean    bill of health.  You can get dressed    now.
Hey, Chief!
Hello, Jake...
I need a favor...
Sure.  What is it.
I'm working on a subspace transceiver    for my science project but I can't    seem to figure out how to get the    emitter crystal to work.
A subspace transceiver model.  I    used to build them when I was your    age... I'll be glad to help...
You don't think it's a conflict of    interest or anything... you being    married to the teacher...
We'll clear it with Keiko... but I    don't think she'll mind.  After all,    it's a chance to help you get those    grades back up, right... ?
Oh, my grades are great.  I just    want to keep them that way.  Thanks,    Chief!
Sisko was telling the truth about    one thing... the upper pylons had    failed again.  It didn't make any    sense...

... because the new pressure locks    I'd installed seemed to be working    just fine... so it had to be an    entirely new problem.  I realized it    wasn't going to be a quick matter to    track it down after all.  And I    couldn't help thinking how this was    going to keep me occupied while the    security arrangements for the Paradas    were underway.
How's it coming, DeCurtis...
Chief.  I thought you had your hands    full with the upper pylons.
I do.  Thought I'd take a break and    check in on your progress.
Everything's on schedule here.  We've    done a complete sweep of all the    quarters assigned to the Paradas.
Open it up.  I'd like to look things    over...
I can't, Chief...
That's an order.
Sir, the security seal was activated    the minute we left.  Only Major Kira    knows the access codes.
O'Brien to Kira.
Go ahead, Chief.
I need the access codes for the Parada    quarters.
Chief, what are you doing down    there...
Commander, I spent a week with the    Paradas going over these arrangements.     I really feel the need to be...
I want those upper pylons operational,    Chief.  That's your priority.     Understood?
Yessir.
Chief!
Is this the right inverter for a    subspace transceiver?
Where'd you get this?  I haven't    seen one of these since I was a kid.
I replicated it... I found a design    in a really really old data file in    the library program...
Really, really old, huh...
I didn't mean...
Don't worry about it.  Why don't you    just come by my place after dinner    tonight and we'll see if we can add    the rest of the pieces...
Great.
Hey, Jake... did anything unusual    happen here at the station while I    was in the Gamma Quadrant last...
Jake.
Your Dad's been looking for you.  I    think he's back in your quarters.     It may be important.
See you later.
Everything under control, Chief?
Under control, Major.
I worked on the pylon controls the    better part of the day.  "Needle in    a haystack" wouldn't do this job    justice.
When I finally found the crack in    the R-F power conduit, I couldn't    imagine how it could've occurred so    deep in the system... unless someone    had broken it deliberately.
Hard day?
You could say that.
You want to lie down before dinner?
No.  Jake's coming over in a little    while.  I'm helping him with his    science project...
Commander Sisko just called.  Jake    can't make it tonight.  He isn't    feeling well.
Really?  He seemed fine a few hours    ago.
Well, you know how it is with kids --    he probably ate too much junk on the    Promenade after school.
Where's Molly?
Oh, she's spending the night over at    the Fredricksons.
Just the two of us, eh?
We should eat while the food is warm.
The replicator can keep it warm.     And I can keep you warm.
What's the problem...
No problem.  I'm just not in the    mood.  I had a hard day too.
Okay, we'll eat.
What is it...
Fricandeau stew.
You don't like Fricandeau stew.
But you do.
Yeah, but...
I just thought you'd appreciate one    of your favorite meals.  I know how    you hate all the strange foods when    you're away... a little endive    salad... sweet flan for dessert...
How... thoughtful of you...
Aren't you having any?
I just feel like having a little    salad...
Not very hungry...
I had a late lunch.
How is it?
You know, maybe I will lie down.
But you haven't eaten a bite...
I just don't seem to have an appetite    right now.

I don't know if there was anything    wrong with the stew or not.  When I    went back later to check, she'd    already put it into the disposal.     But all I could think of, as I looked    at her... was that this was not my    Keiko.
What's that, computer...
Incoming hail from Starfleet Runabout    Rio Grande.
Tell them no one's home.
Please repeat request.
Refuse their hail.
Confirmed.
How much longer to the Parada System    now?
At current speed, twenty-three    minutes, forty seconds.
Can't sleep now.  Gotta stay on top    of things.
"The minstrel boy to the war is gone...   In the ranks of death you'll find him...   His father's sword he hath girded on,    And... "
Computer, open a channel to the Rio    Grande... audio only...
Channel open.

"The minstrel boy to the war is gone...   In the ranks of death you'll find him...   His father's sword he hath girded on,    And his wild harp slung behind him...   Land of song, said the warrior bard,    Tho all the world betrays thee,    One sword at least thy rights shall guard,    One faithful harp shall praise thee."       End of transmission.
Computer, open O'Brien personal log,    play back last sentence.
... But all I could think of as I    looked at her... was that this was    not my Keiko.
(slightly punchdrunk from     fatigue)   You're right.  She wasn't.    (sighs, depressed     anew)   Continue log.       I didn't get much sleep that    night...

I waited for Keiko or whoever she    was... to go to bed... and I started    my search... I had no idea what I    was looking for.  Something odd,    something not quite normal -- anything    to explain what might be going on.
Scan complete.  No unknown    microorganisms detected.
Check for traces of any chemical    agents with bioactive properties.
No chemical agents with bioactive    properties detected.
Any unknown chemical agents?
Negative.
Access internal E-M sensor grid.
Ready.
Scan for any evidence of sub-harmonic    transmissions...
Scan complete.  No sub-harmonic    transmissions detected.
Any unusual neural wave patterns...
Negative.
Any telepathic activity on    board...
Negative.
Computer, display all arriving vessels    from Stardate 47550 to 47571.
None from the Gamma Quadrant?
No ships arrived from the Gamma    Quadrant within time parameters    requested.
Coffee.  Jamaican blend.  Double    strong.  Double sweet.
You're drinking too much of this    stuff, O'Brien.       Anything to stay alert, O'Brien.
Okay, Computer... play back station    logs chronologically, starting with    Stardate 47550.
Identify which officer's logs are to    be included.
(shaking his head,     wishing it weren't     so)   All officers.
Vocal or transcribed?
Vocal.

Station log, Stardate 47552.9.     Admiral Gupta has arrived to    personally assess the Cardassian    movements along the border.  Several    Federation colonies in the    demilitarized zone have complained    of...
... discovered a new lifeform    previously unreported...
... lost in a shuttlepod somewhere in    the vicinity of...
... a request by the Chamber of    Ministers that I find absolutely    ridiculous...
... were completed at seventeen-hundred    hours and seem to be functioning    with no further...
... and the Admiral seemed satisfied    that the Cardassians would not violate    the treaty.
Access denied.
Denied?  Access denied to what?
Station logs after Stardate 47569.4    are restricted.
The day I got back...       Describe the restrictions.
Access restricted to level one    security clearance.
I am level one.
Please enter security verification.
Access denied.
Anything I can help you with, Chief?
Naw... just making sure those upper    pylons are in working condition by    morning...
You're an inspiration to us all.

There were several traps laid into    the computer subroutine, no doubt to    let someone know if I'd penetrated    their security lockout.  I wasn't    fooled for a minute and released the    protected files without any problem.

What I found in those hidden logs    didn't answer all my questions...    but it sure as hell confirmed what    I'd been afraid of.  They were    analyzing and reanalyzing everything    I had put in my report about Paradan    security.  They'd even broken into    my personal logs to see what they    could find in there.  I hope they    enjoyed reading the sexy letters to    my wife.  There were several entries    by Sisko about secured messages from    the Parada system but no indication    what those messages were about.     Maybe they were afraid I'd get into    their files even with the security    lockout.  Smart people.
Chief.
Odo, we've got a problem.  I've got    to talk to you.
It's good to see you too...
Aside from Jake, not one of them    was... I don't know... real.  I'm    not sure who we can trust on the    station at this point...
Do any of them know you're    suspicious...

Probably.  I've asked a few questions,    been a few places that might tip    them off.  They'll be keeping close    tabs on me...       I'd call Starfleet but what would I    tell them... my wife doesn't seem    like my wife... Sisko's making    security arrangements without    consulting me...
They might even call Commander Sisko    and start asking questions about    you...
That's what I was afraid of...
When are the Paradas due?
Thirty-eight hours.
I don't want them coming anywhere    near this place until we've got this    cleared up...
Agreed.

Go on about your business.  Don't do    anything that might get their    attention.  In the meantime, I'll do    some investigating.  If I can confirm    your suspicions, we can go to    Starfleet and the Bajoran authorities    at the same time.
I'm glad you're back, Odo.
We'll get to the bottom of this.
I felt better than I had for a long    time.  I finally had an ally.  Now,    all I had to do was wait.       I like to think I'm a man with many    talents.  But waiting isn't one of    them.
The odds are against you, O'Brien.
Against me, what are you talking    about...
You know what I'm talking about...    you look tired... have you been    getting enough sleep...
What are you talking about, Quark...
Racquetball?  The rematch with Bashir    next week?  We never finished the    first one, remember?
My, we are jumpy, aren't we.
Change the subject.
Fine, we'll change the subject.       So.  Tell me about the Paradas.
They're going to be here, when,    tomorrow?
Why would you want to know about the    Paradas...
It's always good business to know    about new customers before they walk    in your door.
Yeah... ?  Which Rule of Acquisition    is that?
Oh, one of the high numbers... one    ninety-four, I think...
You're gonna have to find out about    the Paradas from someone else.
Odo to O'Brien.
(still staring at     Quark)   Go ahead.
Can I see you in my office...
I'm on my way.
I see what you mean.
What did you find out?
Sit down.       How much do you know about the Paradan    rebels...
Don't ask me to explain the politics    of the situation there... but I know    they've been fighting the government    forces for twelve years... why?
I'm just trying to understand the    players involved here...
Odo, Sisko's logs indicated that    secret messages have been coming    from the Parada System... could those    messages have been from the    rebels?
As a matter of fact, they were.
That's already a breach of the    security agreement we made with the    Paradan Government... and it's a    good enough reason for us to cancel    these peace talks...
That... still might be premature...
What are you talking about... we've    got more than enough to...
They got to you.
Don't be ridiculous.  I'm just trying    to...
No, they did.  They got to you.
Why don't we all calm down and have    a talk...
Who the hell are you...
We're not going to hurt you.
This will help you relax...
Thanks just the same.
Computer, lock on to my combadge,    initiate emergency transport to    runabout Rio Grande...
Unable to complete request.  Please    contact station commander for    assistance.
Making it tough for me, huh... fine...    you want forcefields, I'll give you    forcefields...
There.  You want to get to me now...    you'll have to release them all.
Thank you very much.
Jake!  Are you okay, lad?
Yeah...
Good.  Listen to me.  Something isn't    normal here.  Your dad, the others --    something's happened to them... you    and I are the only ones who can    help...
Jake Sisko to Security.  He's here!     Level H-two, section five!
It's gonna be okay... just surrender    to them and you'll be fine...
Spread out... check all quarters...    advise people to stay where they    are... and not to let anyone in...
Shut down your engines.
Sorry, Commander... I have no    intention of doing that...
You will not be allowed to leave.  I    repeat, shut down your engines.
If you check your systems, you'll    find the mooring clamps are already    unlocked and your tractor beams are    off-line.  O'Brien out.
Shields up!
Are the shields holding, Computer...
Shields at seventy-one percent...
Warning.  Shields at forty-nine    percent...
Transfer emergency life support power    to shield generators...
Transfer complete...
Shield status...
Shields at ninety-three percent...
Full impulse... heading four-one    mark three-three-zero...
Confirmed.
Open a subspace channel to Starbase    four zero one.  Priority one.  Admiral    Rollman.
Stand by.
Admiral -- Miles O'Brien, Chief of    Operations, Deep Space Nine...
I know who you are...

I have to apprise you of an emergency    situation on the station... there    has been some sort of... takeover...    a conspiracy... I believe it has    something to do with the Paradan    peace talks...
Listen to me very carefully.  Return    to D.S. Nine immediately.
Admiral, you don't understand... I    believe Commander Sisko and all the    senior officers have fallen under    the influence of something that...
Turn the ship around and go back.     You will not be harmed.
It seemed almost unbelievable to me.     Had someone or something started to    infiltrate all of Starfleet?
Computer, new heading.  One-eight-   zero mark three-one.  To the wormhole.
I decided the only alternative left    was to go back to the Parada system...    to warn them... and maybe... to find    some answers.
scene: 69   EXT. WORMHOLE - THE RUNABOUT GOING THROUGH (OPTICAL)

quote: Coffee.  Jamaican blend.  Double    strong.  Double sweet.
Time to Parada system, Computer...
One minute, twenty seconds.
How much lead time do we have on the    Mekong...
At current speeds, seven minutes,    four seconds...
That's gonna disappear in a hurry    once we drop out of warp...       At least I get to choose where they    catch up...
Computer, identify the largest planet    in the Parada system...
Parada Four...
Adjust course to approach Parada    Four...
Confirmed...
How many moons around Parada Four,    Computer...
Seven...
Lucky seven.  Display their    coordinates...
Approaching the Parada system.
Drop to impulse...
Status of Mekong...
Mekong has dropped out of warp and    has adjusted course to identical    heading...
Perfect.  How much time have they    made up on us...
At current speeds, the Mekong is two    minutes, one second behind this    vessel.
Adjust our speed to let them catch    up to us in...    (figuring, checking     sensors)   ... thirty seconds.
Dropping to point-four-impulse.
Come on... come on... I'm waiting    for ya...
Warning.  Entering polar magnetic    field.  Sensors will be nonfunctional    for twenty-seven seconds... switch    to manual navigation...
Switching.
Computer, full impulse, engage!
Confirmed.  Manual navigation in    effect.
Shut down engines, all main power    systems.  Maintain silent running    status.
Confirmed.
Yeah... where did I go?  Now you see    me.  Now you don't.    (beat, waiting for     them to commit)   What's it going to be, fellas?  I    can play hide and seek with the best    of them.
No time for games, huh... Computer,    identify Mekong's new heading.
Four-one mark two-zero-one.
Probable destination?
Parada Two.
Parada Two.  What's on Parada Two?       Computer, monitor all transporter    activity to and from the Mekong...
Mekong transporter has been energized.
They beamed to the surface?
Confirmed.
How many people?
Three people.
Anyone left on board?
Negative.
Set a course for Parada Two... take    us into a synchronous orbit above    their location on the surface.
Having a little unscheduled    negotiation with the rebels, are we?
You don't understand... put down    your weapons and we'll explain...
I've got a better idea... you put    down yours first.  Do it.
You too.
Everything you need to understand is    behind this door.
Sure.  Like a squadron of rebels,    maybe?
No.  If you'd just permit me...
Just stay where you are.
Listen to him.  He's not your enemy.     We're not your enemy...
Please.  This will explain    everything...
I don't want to hurt you...
Doctor, we need you!
... He's perfect.  He looks just like    me.
Apparently he thought he was you.
No doubt they thought that would    make him more convincing.

We believe there was a triggering    mechanism programmed into him that    would have taken over during the    peace talks.  The government    scientists have learned to do    remarkable things with replicants.
What was he programmed to do?
We're not entirely sure.  Assassinate    someone at the peace talks, we think.     Perhaps our entire delegation.
They were tipped off by one of their    informants in the government.
There was a rumor you'd been abducted    and replaced by a replicant.
We've had people looking for you    ever since.
We had no way to prove he wasn't    you.  He passed a physical exam with    flying colors.  He sure knew his way    around the station.
They had more wires connected to my    head than you could count.  Now, I    know why.
We were trying to shut him out of    every sensitive security area while    they were searching for you.  I'm    sure he wondered what the hell was    going on with all of us.
By the time we learned you'd been    rescued, he'd already gotten away    from us and was on his way here.
I wonder why he was coming back...
If it was me, I'd be trying to warn    somebody that something was terribly    wrong at the station...
Maybe, in a strange sort of way, he    was just trying to be a hero...
Keiko!
What about her... ?
Tell her... I love...
